intro: Fagara setosa, commonly known as the smooth fagara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often glossy and dark green. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, attracting various pollinators. Fagara setosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth.
